required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Japanese Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Extension Study of Multiple Subcutaneous Doses of LY2127399 in Japanese Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis Treated With Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of 48 weeks subcutaneous dosing with LY2127399 for patients who have participated in a prior LY2127399 clinical study. At the end of the 48 week treatment period, patients will participate in a 24 week follow up period. Additional follow up after week 72 may continue to assess B cell recovery.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Anti-Cyclic Citrullinated Peptide antibody (anti-CCP)
Change from baseline in Rheumatoid Factor
Change from baseline in Immunoglobulins (IgG, IgM, and IgA)
Change from baseline in CD20+ B cells
Change from baseline in Peripheral B cell subsets
Change from baseline in C-reactive protein
Change from baseline in Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)

arm_group.description: Subjects in the 30 mg every 4 weeks arm of lead in study will receive 30 mg every four weeks until the safety of the 120 mg every 4 weeks dose is confirmed in the lead in study.

Subjects in the 60 mg every 4 weeks, 120 mg every 4 weeks and 120 mg every 2 weeks arms of the lead in study will receive 120 mg every 4 weeks as these patients will enroll in this study after the safety of the 120 mg every 4 weeks dose in the lead in study is confirmed.

intervention.description: Administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks for 48 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- Have given written informed consent
- Women must not be pregnant, breastfeeding or be at risk to become pregnant during study participation
- Must have completed treatment and 12 week follow up period in prior LY2127399 study
Exclusion criteria
- Have had any safety event during the study for LY2127399 that patients participated in previous
- Have received, during previous study, any drugs prohibited in the study protocol which includes unapproved drugs, live vaccines, or any biologic or non-biologic DMARD except for MTX, hydroxychloroquine, sulfasalazine or bucillamine
